caption.p: Survival curves for 96 hpf zebrafish embryos exposed with acetonic ( A) or aqueous ( B) extracts from A. borbonica at high concentrations of 16.9 g/L (acetonic) and 40 g/L (aqueous) and a low concentration of 2.3 g/L (acetonic and aqueous), and E3 was considered as control. Median lethal concentration curves (LC 50) for 96 hpf zebrafish embryos and 72 hpf larvae exposed to acetonic ( C, E) or aqueous ( D, F) extracts at different concentrations ranging from 16.9 to 1.3 g/L (acetonic) and 40 to 2.3 g/L (aqueous) for 4 and 2 days, respectively. The LC 50 values were expressed in g/L. Data are the mean Â± SD of three independent experiments.
